page.title: 14BUNTINGS TOMATO NURSERY
page.content: The Buntings moved to Gt.Horkesley in 1979 other being in the Nursery business for 150years on land near the North Station in Colchester.They grow tomatoes in glasshouses over 2 acre blocks is separately controlled.Single tomato seeds are sown on the last two days of October and are grown in the propagating house until they are 9". They are then planted in small packs of Rockwell,which is made from a basalt type rock which has been heated and spun and looks like insulating fibre,no earth or peat is used.They grow in the main houses,(a great deal heat has to be used during the winter) and picking starts in February and continues until October on the same plants.The tomato plants grow to about 35ft long and are layered.Every 7 days they are twisted,side shooted and lowered to the same height.
